definition: Song Qingling or Rosemonde Soong (1893-1981), wife of Sun Yat-sen 孫中山|孙中山[Sun1 Zhong1 shan1]
surname Song/the Song dynasty (960-1279)/also Song of the Southern dynasties 南朝宋 (420-479)
to celebrate
age/length of experience, membership etc

sentences.english: This is the former residence of Soong Ching Ling.
sentences.chinese: 這是原居住地的宋慶齡。

sentences.english: I agree to abide by the admission procedures of Soong Ching Ling School.
sentences.chinese: 我同意遵守宋慶齡學校的入學程序。

definition: Soong Mei-ling (1898-2003), Chiang Kai-shek's second wife
Chiang Kai-shek (1887-1975), military leader, head of the Nationalist government in China 1928-1949 and the government in exile on Taiwan 1950-1975
Liu Shaoqi (1898-1969), Chinese communist leader, a martyr of the Cultural Revolution
Zhang Shizhao (1881-1973), revolutionary journalist in Shanghai, then established writer
Wang Ching-wei (1883-1944), left-wing Guomingdang politician, subsequently Japanese collaborator
Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党/same as 孫逸仙|孙逸仙
Chen Yi (1901-1972), communist general and politician, Marshal of PLA from 1955, Mayor of Shanghai in 1950s, PRC foreign minister 1958-1972
Mao Zedong (1893-1976), Chinese communist leader
Zhou Enlai (1898-1976), Chinese communist leader, prime minister 1949-1976
Chiang Wei-kuo (1916-1997), adopted son of Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
Chiang Ching-kuo (1910-1988), son of Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石, Guomindang politician, president of ROC 1978-1988
Zhang Xueliang (1901-2001) son of Fengtian clique warlord, then senior general for the Nationalists and subsequently for the People's Liberation Army
Yu Dafu (1896-1945), poet and novelist
He Long (1896-1969), important communist military leader, died from persecution during the Cultural Revolution
Xiao Hong (1911-1942), prominent woman writer, originally from Heilongjiang
Premier Zhou Enlai 周恩來|周恩来 (1898-1976)
